title: How to Make Sweet Potato Patties

methods.name: Making a Basic Sweet Potato Patty

steps.headline: Cook and cool your rice.
steps.description: Before you add it to the patties, your rice should be cooked and cool. Plan ahead a little. Cook your rice the night before or a few hours before cooking your patties so it has a chance to cool off. To cook rice, add the appropriate amount of water to to make half a cup of rice. The package should indicate the ratio, but usually it's a 1:2 ratio. You would likely use half a cup of water. Bring your water to a boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, add your rice. Bring the heat down to a simmer and cover your pot. Brown rice generally cooks for around 30 minutes. Check your pot after the 30 minute mark and, if the rice is cooked, remove it from the heat.

steps.headline: Stir the rice, sweet potato, salt, and onion together.
steps.description: Once you've cooked your rice, get a large mixing bowl. Stir together the rice, sweet potato, salt, and onion using a mixing spoon. Stir together until you have an even mixture. Set the mixing bowl aside for a few minutes afterwards. This allows the salt to remove excess moisture from the potato and onion.

steps.headline: Add your flour.
steps.description: Add a little bit of flour at a time. You only need enough to make the batter sticky and easily moldable. If necessary, you may have to add a few splashes of water if your mixture becomes too dry.

steps.headline: Form your patties.
steps.description: Form tight balls with the batter. The size is up to you. You can choose how big or small you want your patties to be. After rolling the batter into balls, squish it slightly to form a patty shape. Always wash your hands before handling food.

steps.headline: Cook your patties.
steps.description: Place a large skillet over medium heat. Let it warm up for a few minutes before adding oil. Then, cook your patties one by one. Allow them to cook for seven to ten minutes on one side. Then, flip your patties and cook them for an additional five to seven minutes.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve your patties.
steps.description: Allow your patties to cool for a few minutes before serving. You can serve them on their own with a dipping sauce. You can also serve them with buns and garnish them with lettuce and condiments.

methods.name: Making a Garlic Cilantro Sweet Potato Patty

steps.headline: Mash your sweet potatoes.
steps.description: To mash sweet potatoes, cut them into cubes. Place them in a pot of water over low heat. Cook them for about 30 minutes while stirring occasionally. When the potatoes are done, you will be able to poke through them with a fork. Transfer them to a bowl and use a fork to mash them.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Once your potatoes are mashed, add the green onions, sour cream, egg, bread crumbs, cilantro, and garlic. Use a spoon to mix everything together. Make sure you have an even mixture before proceeding.

steps.headline: Add salt and pepper.
steps.description: Add your salt and pepper a little at at time, tasting the batter in between. Add enough salt and pepper that you have your desired taste.

steps.headline: Form your patties.
steps.description: Roll your patties into small balls of your desired size. Then, smash the balls slightly to form patty shapes. Wash your hands before handling your batter.

steps.headline: Cook your patties.
steps.description: Add your vegetable oil to a medium sauce pan and allow it to heat for a few minutes. Then, add your patties. Cook them for five to ten minutes on each side. Allow your patties to cool for a few minutes before serving them.

methods.name: Making a Bacon Sweet Potato Patty

steps.headline: Boil your sweet potatoes.
steps.description: Add your potatoes to a large saucepan. Cover them with warm water and then bring the water to a boil. Once the water is boiling, lower the heat and let your potatoes simmer for five to eight minutes. When done, you should be able to easily pierce your potatoes with a fork.

steps.headline: Fry your bacon.
steps.description: Place a skillet over medium heat and add your bacon. Fry it to your desired level of crispiness, flipping about halfway through the cooking process. Once you're done, set your bacon aside to cool.

steps.headline: Mash your potatoes.
steps.description: Remove your potatoes from the water. Use a fork to mash them into a smooth, even texture.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients.
steps.description: Shred your bacon and add it to the mix. Then, add the onion and egg. Use a spoon to mix everything together into a even mixture.

steps.headline: Form your patties.
steps.description: Form your patties into small balls of your desired size. Then, squish the balls to form patty shapes. Make sure to wash your hands before handling your batter.

steps.headline: Cook your patties.
steps.description: Heat your choice of cooking oil over a skillet at medium-high heat. Fry your patties until they're golden brown. This should take around four minutes per side.

text: Making a Basic Sweet Potato Patty Cook and cool your rice. Before you add it to the patties, your rice should be cooked and cool. Plan ahead a little. Cook your rice the night before or a few hours before cooking your patties so it has a chance to cool off. To cook rice, add the appropriate amount of water to to make half a cup of rice. The package should indicate the ratio, but usually it's a 1:2 ratio. You would likely use half a cup of water. Bring your water to a boil over high heat. Once the water is boiling, add your rice. Bring the heat down to a simmer and cover your pot. Brown rice generally cooks for around 30 minutes. Check your pot after the 30 minute mark and, if the rice is cooked, remove it from the heat. Stir the rice, sweet potato, salt, and onion together. Once you've cooked your rice, get a large mixing bowl. Stir together the rice, sweet potato, salt, and onion using a mixing spoon. Stir together until you have an even mixture. Set the mixing bowl aside for a few minutes afterwards. This allows the salt to remove excess moisture from the potato and onion. Add your flour. Add a little bit of flour at a time. You only need enough to make the batter sticky and easily moldable. If necessary, you may have to add a few splashes of water if your mixture becomes too dry. Form your patties. Form tight balls with the batter. The size is up to you. You can choose how big or small you want your patties to be. After rolling the batter into balls, squish it slightly to form a patty shape. Always wash your hands before handling food. Cook your patties. Place a large skillet over medium heat. Let it warm up for a few minutes before adding oil. Then, cook your patties one by one. Allow them to cook for seven to ten minutes on one side. Then, flip your patties and cook them for an additional five to seven minutes. Garnish and serve your patties. Allow your patties to cool for a few minutes before serving. You can serve them on their own with a dipping sauce. You can also serve them with buns and garnish them with lettuce and condiments. Cook them for about 30 minutes while stirring occasionally. When the potatoes are done, you will be able to poke through them with a fork. Transfer them to a bowl and use a fork to mash them. Add the remaining ingredients. Once your potatoes are mashed, add the green onions, sour cream, egg, bread crumbs, cilantro, and garlic. Use a spoon to mix everything together. Make sure you have an even mixture before proceeding. Add salt and pepper. Add your salt and pepper a little at at time, tasting the batter in between. Add enough salt and pepper that you have your desired taste. Form your patties. Roll your patties into small balls of your desired size. Then, smash the balls slightly to form patty shapes. Wash your hands before handling your batter. Cook your patties. Add your vegetable oil to a medium sauce pan and allow it to heat for a few minutes. Then, add your patties. Cook them for five to ten minutes on each side. Allow your patties to cool for a few minutes before serving them. Making a Bacon Sweet Potato Patty Boil your sweet potatoes. Add your potatoes to a large saucepan. Cover them with warm water and then bring the water to a boil. Once the water is boiling, lower the heat and let your potatoes simmer for five to eight minutes. When done, you should be able to easily pierce your potatoes with a fork. Fry your bacon. Place a skillet over medium heat and add your bacon. Fry it to your desired level of crispiness, flipping about halfway through the cooking process. Once you're done, set your bacon aside to cool. Mash your potatoes. Remove your potatoes from the water. Use a fork to mash them into a smooth, even texture. Add the remaining ingredients. Shred your bacon and add it to the mix. Then, add the onion and egg. Use a spoon to mix everything together into a even mixture. Form your patties. Form your patties into small balls of your desired size. Then, squish the balls to form patty shapes. Make sure to wash your hands before handling your batter. Cook your patties. Heat your choice of cooking oil over a skillet at medium-high heat. Fry your patties until they're golden brown. This should take around four minutes per side.
